name: CrossRef API
description: Comprehensive academic publication metadata API providing access to citation data, DOI information, and research metadata from 18,000+ publishers. Enables discovery of academic works, citation relationships, and scholarly communication data.

access_info.pricing_model: free with optional paid CrossRef Plus service

research_notes.researcher_notes: Robust API with comprehensive documentation, supports filtering and pagination, backed by major academic publishers
research_notes.api_summary: CrossRef API provides comprehensive access to academic publication metadata from over 18,000 publishers worldwide, offering real-time citation data, DOI resolution, and scholarly communication insights. The API supports advanced filtering, sorting, and pagination capabilities, making it essential for bibliometric analysis, research discovery platforms, and academic data integration projects.

name: ORCID API
description: Researcher identification API providing access to unique researcher profiles, academic achievements, and professional activities. Connects research outputs to verified researcher identities through persistent digital identifiers.

access_info.pricing_model: free public API, paid member API with enhanced features

research_notes.researcher_notes: Requires OAuth2 authentication, well-documented API with multiple access levels, integrates with institutional systems
research_notes.api_summary: ORCID API enables access to verified researcher profiles and their academic achievements through persistent digital identifiers. The API provides comprehensive access to researcher biographical data, employment history, publications, peer review activities, and funding information, supporting institutional integrations and research analytics platforms through OAuth2 authentication.

name: PubMed API (NCBI E-utilities)
description: Comprehensive biomedical literature database API providing access to over 34 million citations, abstracts, and full-text articles. Essential resource for medical research, pharmaceutical development, and healthcare informatics.

access_info.rate_limits: 3 requests/second without API key, 10 requests/second with API key

endpoints: einfo.fcgi - Database statistics and field information
elink.fcgi - Related records and external links

research_notes.researcher_notes: Government-funded resource with comprehensive biomedical coverage, requires API key for reasonable rate limits, excellent documentation
research_notes.api_summary: PubMed API (NCBI E-utilities) provides comprehensive access to the world's largest biomedical literature database, containing over 34 million citations from MEDLINE, life science journals, and online books. The API supports complex queries, field-specific searches, and related article discovery, making it indispensable for medical research, systematic reviews, pharmaceutical development, and healthcare informatics applications.

name: arXiv API
description: Open access preprint repository API providing access to cutting-edge research papers in physics, mathematics, computer science, and other scientific disciplines. Enables discovery of latest research before peer review publication.

endpoints: /query - Primary search and retrieval endpoint with search_query parameter
/query?id_list - Retrieve specific papers by arXiv ID

research_notes.researcher_notes: Simple API with comprehensive search capabilities, excellent for accessing cutting-edge research, no authentication required
research_notes.api_summary: arXiv API provides open access to over 2 million preprint manuscripts across physics, mathematics, computer science, biology, finance, and statistics. The API enables real-time discovery of cutting-edge research before traditional peer review publication, supporting advanced Boolean searches, field-specific queries, and comprehensive metadata access for academic research platforms and scientific monitoring systems.

name: Zenodo API
description: Research data repository API enabling storage, sharing, and discovery of research outputs including datasets, software, publications, and multimedia. Provides DOI assignment and long-term preservation for scientific data.

endpoints: /deposit/depositions - Create, manage, and publish research outputs

research_notes.researcher_notes: CERN-backed repository with excellent GitHub integration, supports large datasets up to 50GB, automatic DOI assignment
research_notes.api_summary: Zenodo API provides comprehensive access to a research data repository backed by CERN, offering unlimited free storage for datasets, software, publications, and other research outputs. The API supports DOI assignment, version control, metadata management, and GitHub integration, making it essential for research data management, preservation, and sharing in compliance with open science practices.
